column4: When I view 3d content moving fast, it's like a part of the screen moves, then the other part stays still, and then the other also moves. Is that related to vsync (or what it's called)? Nvidia gpu on Ubuntu 11.10.
usually vsync (issue is typically called tearing)
any settings I can change to prevent it from happening?
turn vsync on - typically there is both an nvidia setting and a compiz setting for it (or there used to be in compiz)
is that "Sync to VBlank" in the nvidia driver settings? It's already enabled
did you say it tearing in 3d?  check the "OpenGL Settings" in nvidia-settings there a "Sync to VBlank" there as well.
Sync to Vblank is already checked. I googled tearing and found this http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2010/01/how-to-fix-video-tearing-in-videos-nvidia-ubuntu/ will try it now
for videos, be use "X Server XVideo Settings" in nvida-setting already has "Sync to VBlank" then.
what video player are you using?  and what VO (Video Output) are you using with that video player?  XV vs GL vs VDPAU might give very different results.
I meant 3d as in a 3d game. More specifically webgl
webgl, i see.  well, good luck man.
is it not related to vsync then?
don't have the slightest idea sorry.  good luck.
heh, ok, I hope I can find a solution, as it's quite annoying
hmm, now I see the CompizConfig says refresh rate is 50 while my monitors are 60Hz. Does it make sense to also set compiz to 60?
